business.headline: Dr Reddy's, Aurobindo Pharma: Why pharma stocks fell in early trade today?The Nifty Pharma index dropped as much as 2% in early trade. Sun Pharma fell nearly 2%, Dr Reddy's dropped as much as 4%, and Aurobindo Pharma sank almost 6%. Cipla shares also fell.

Tata Motors shares get boost after CLSA upgrade. Check target priceTata Motors share price: At around 11:04 am, shares of Tata Motors were trading 0.34% higher at Rs 683.90 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). It was up over 1% in early trade.

Hexaware Technologies shares debut at 5% premium over IPO priceHexaware Technologies IPO listing: The listing was largely in line with expectations, as the grey market premium (GMP) had disappeared ahead of the debut, indicating weak demand.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT, pharma stocks drag marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex shed 291.20 points to 75,676.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 88.65 points to 22,856.65 as of 9:25 AM.

Quality Power IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing date Quality Power IPO allotment status: Investors who applied for the Quality Power IPO can check their allotment status through the BSE website or the registrar's website (Link Intime India Private Ltd).

Elon Musk's Tesla hunts for land in India, Maharashtra leads: ReportWhile Maharashtra is leading the race, other states are also vying for the project. Tesla's plans could change depending on the incentives offered by different states.

Unified Pension Scheme to roll out from April 1. Check eligibility and benefitsUnder the new pension scheme, government employees will contribute 10% of their basic salary along with DA, while the government's contribution will rise from the previous 14% to 18.5%.

ELSS explained: Check tax benefits under Section 80C and other key details ELSS offers market-linked returns and has the potential to generate higher long-term returns as compared to other Section 80C options, including PPF, ULIPS, and NPS, etc.

Trump's reciprocal tariffs could hurt Indian exports. Which sectors are at risk?While officials are still waiting for details on how these tariffs will be calculated, they are already preparing countermeasures and working on a trade deal proposal to reduce tariffs and boost two-way trade.

Sensex, Nifty bounce back from day's low to close flat; IT stocks lead recoveryThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 29.47 points to close at 75,967.39, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 14.20 points to end at 22,945.30.

Want to save taxes? Try these 5 last-minute investment options to maximise benefitsThe Equity-Linked Savings Scheme (ELSS) is a popular tax-saving tool available under Section 80C, offering a lock-in period of three years. Under this, investments up to Rs 1.5 lakh are eligible for deductions.

Sugar gets costlier: Prices rise 6.5% in a month as output dipsSugar price hike: A drop in sugar output, caused by adverse weather and the reopening of sugar exports after two years, has led to a supply shortage, pushing up prices.

entertainment.headline: Rihanna 'thankful, humbled' after A$AP Rocky found not guilty in shooting caseA$AP Rocky was declared not guilty in a felony assault trial, leading to an emotional embrace with Rihanna in court. After the verdict, the singer issued her first statement, expressing relief.

Retro hits to soulful music: Magical evening at Papon's Valentine's Day special showPapon's concert in Delhi, hosted by TV9, was an unforgettable night filled with soulful music. Held at Major Dhyan Chand National Stadium, the event was part of the World Travel and Tourism Festival.

Watch: Arijit Singh attends father's video call during live concertArijit Singh's live concert in Chandigarh was made memorable by a surprise video call from his father during his performance. The singer shared heartfelt moments from the event on Instagram, expressing gratitude to his fans.

Pics: Singer Anuv Jain married, shares photos with wifeSinger Anuv Jain, popular for songs like Baarishein, is now married. He shared photos from the wedding and pre-wedding festivities on social media.

Singer Akhil Sachdeva on Diljit Dosanjh's infrastructure remark: I feel it's amazingSinger Akhil Sachdeva discusses the rise of concerts in India, film vs indie music, ticket prices, and Diljit Dosanjh's comments on concert infrastructure. He also stresses the importance of crediting technicians.

K-slate 2025: When Life Gives You Tangerine to Wife of a 21st Century PrinceKakao Entertainment is set to make 2025 a landmark year for K-dramas and films, with a rich array of releases across various genres. From gripping thrillers to heartwarming romances, the lineup promises stellar performances and captivating stories.

Dabba Cartel trailer: Shabana Azmi, Jyotika promise an addictive showThe trailer for Netflix's Dabba Cartel unveils a gripping crime drama about five women whose dabba business unexpectedly plunges them into the dangerous world of a drug cartel.

Kim Sae-ron's father blames YouTuber for death, co-star Won Bin breaks downSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron's father spoke out at her funeral, held a day after her death, highlighting the emotional distress she suffered due to a YouTuber's videos.

Karan Singh Grover back on TV 5 years after Kasautii Zindagii Kay: ReportActor Karan Singh Grover might just be a part of a romantic show very soon. He is reported to be seen alongside Helly Shah in this new TV show.

Late Linkin Park singer Chester Bennington's child comes out as transgenderLinkin Park singer Chester Bennington's child, Draven, has come out as transgender. The artiste shared the news on her social media handle, while stating her preferred pronouns in a small note.

Amit Trivedi: Global artists performing in India is nothing but pure businessIndia has become a hotspot for global artists to perform, drawing big names like Coldplay, Ed Sheeran, and Dua Lipa. Music composer Amit Trivedi believes their choice is driven by business interests, as they seek lucrative opportunities in the country.

Bridgerton 4 first look: Benedict-Sophie's love story takes centre stageThe fourth season of Bridgerton is set to spotlight Benedict Bridgerton's romance with Sophie Baek. New characters like Katie Leung's Lady Araminta Gun will add intrigue to the season.

general news.headline: BJP yet to announce its Delhi Chief Minister, tomorrow's oath invite already outOnce the newly-elected MLAs from Delhi announce the chief minister today, he or she will meet Lt Governor VK Saxena at his residence and stake claim to power.

US regulator seeks Law Ministry's help in Adani bribery case, shows court filingGautam Adani bribery case: The US Securities and Exchange Commission has requested the Indian government's assistance in its probe of industrialist Gautam Adani and his nephew in connection with the USD 265 million bribery case, according to a court filing.

I've lot of respect for PM, but why are we giving $21 million to India? TrumpEarlier this week, the Elon Musk-led Department of Government Efficiency announced that it had slashed $723 million in foreign aid funding, including a $21 million grant for India aimed at increasing "voter turnout".

US advertises 'cuffs and shackles' treatment for illegal immigrants in videoThe US posted a video showing illegal immigrants in shackles as they prepare them to board a deportation flight in America. The deportation of illegal immigrants comes as part of a sweeping crackdown by President Donald Trump on illegal immigration.

High levels of faecal bacteria in Sangam water. How high is health risk?The National Green Tribunal has raised concerns over high faecal coliform bacteria levels in water near Sangam in Prayagraj. A report by the Central Pollution Control Board indicated high levels of faecal coliform amid the Maha Kumbh. What are the health risks associated with high levels of faecal bacteria in water?

Trump wanted 'somebody smarter' than Elon Musk to head DOGE, 'settled on him'Donald Trump made the remarks during his first joint TV interview with Elon Musk since returning to the White House in January.

Why H-1B visa for Indians costs anywhere between 1.7 and 6 lakhs?For Indian professionals dreaming of working in the US, the H-1B visa is the favourite of visas. The H-1B visa involves a lottery system and can cost up to Rs 6.1 lakh. Here's a breakdown of the expense and how much an H-1B visa might cost for an employer and applicant.

Is the Champions Trophy still relevant in the age of T20 cricket dominance?The Champions Trophy returns to the cricket calendar after an eight-year hiatus. Despite the dominance of T20 cricket, ODI cricket still holds significance through marquee tournaments like the Champions Trophy and World Cup. Multi-nation events could be key to reviving its relevance in a crowded cricketing calendar.

How Vicky Kaushal became Chhaava: Sword training, horse riding and daily scarsVicky Kaushal trained for six months for Chhaava, enduring 6–8 hours of daily prep, including sword fighting and horse riding. The historical drama has crossed Rs 165 crore in five days at the box office.

Bengaluru man wins case against PVR-INOX for wasting time with 25-min adsA consumer court in Bengaluru ruled in favour of a man who sued PVR Cinemas and INOX for wasting his time with long commercial advertisements. The court also directed the multiplex chain to specify actual movie start times on tickets.

Elon Musk's Tesla hunts for land in India, Maharashtra leads: ReportWhile Maharashtra is leading the race, other states are also vying for the project. Tesla's plans could change depending on the incentives offered by different states.

Gurugram woman warns of 'predators posing as brokers', shares horrifying experience In a post titled "Girls in Gurugram - Be aware of potential predators posing as brokers," the Reddit user recounted her horrifying experience that left her feeling alarmed and grateful for not being alone at the time.

Listen up, ladies. Doctors don't want you to ignore these health signs, symptomsDoctors say women tend to ignore a lot of signs and symptoms indicating serious health risks. Here is a comprehensive guide to recognising them.

No cold war: Eknath Shinde rejects reports of rift with Devendra FadnavisMaharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said there was "absolutely no cold war" between him and Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis.

Watch: US rapper hugs Rihanna after 'not guilty' verdict in assault caseAfter a three-week trial, the jury deliberated for just three hours to reach the verdict that spared Rocky, whose legal name is Rakim Mayers, a prison sentence that could have run more than two decades.

Gyanesh Kumar takes charge as new poll body chief, replaces Rajiv KumarFormer bureaucrat Gyanesh Kumar replaced Rajiv Kumar and took charge as India's 26th Chief Election Commissioner and said the first step towards nation building is voting.

Bharat Jodo Yatra inspired wedding invite takes unity in diversity to next levelA wedding invitation titled 'Bharat Jodo Vivah' celebrating the nuptials of a Jammu-based girl and a Kerala-based boy has warmed the hearts of many social media users. Inspired by Congress's Bharat Jodo Yatra, the card highlights the couple's cultural backgrounds, with personal invitations to Rahul and Priyanka Gandhi.
Guillain-Barré Syndrome can be life-impairing: How to detect, fight the diseaseKey facts about the autoimmune nerve condition that, in severe cases, can even cause paralysis

What online buzz reveals about Delhi Chief Minister probablesParvesh Verma, former Leader of Opposition Vijender Gupta, Rekha Gupta, Satish Upadhyay, Ashish Sood and Jitender Mahajan are among the leading contenders for the Delhi chief minister's post.

Uttarakhand man posing as Amit Shah's son demands Rs 5 lakh from MLA, arrestedThe 19-year-old accused, Priyanshu Pant was arrested in Delhi on Monday night. A second accomplice was taken into custody in Uttarakhand, while a search operation is on for the third accused.

How Diya Kumari's lunch became a talking point on Rajasthan Budget'Green' and 'clean' buzzed as the deputy CM cum finance minister offered broad indicators about her first full-fledged Budget, to be presented on February 19

After Andhra, Telangana allows Muslim staff to leave early during RamzanThe Andhra Pradesh government issued a government order allowing Muslim employees to leave work an hour early during Ramzan, similar to the one issued in Telangana. However, while the BJP in Telangana slammed the ruling Congress for "appeasement politics", in Andhra Pradesh, the alliance party kept quiet.

Videos of women patients at Gujarat maternity hospital leaked, sold on TelegramVideos of women patients at Payal Maternity Hospital were uploaded to a YouTube channel, with access offered via a Telegram link for a fee ranging from Rs 999 to Rs 1,500.

Trump scolds Zelenskyy for complaining about US-Russia talks without UkraineUS President Donald Trump blamed his Ukrainian counterpart Voldodymyr Zelenskyy for "starting" the war in his country and said he should have ended it through a deal with Russia nearly three years ago.

Sanam Teri Kasam re-release box office Day 12: Harshvardhan's film beats TumbbadSanam Teri Kasam re-release box office collection Day 12: Sanam Teri Kasam has now emerged as the highest-grossing re-release Bollywood film ever, after surpassing Tumbbad which collected Rs 31.35 crore nett in its second innings at the box office.

Rishab Shetty right choice for Shivaji Maharaj: Costume designer Ashley RebelloNoted costume designer Ashley Rebello will work with Rishab Shetty and team in The Pride of Bharat: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. The historical drama is directed by Sandeep Singh.

Rihanna 'thankful, humbled' after A$AP Rocky found not guilty in shooting caseA$AP Rocky was declared not guilty in a felony assault trial, leading to an emotional embrace with Rihanna in court. After the verdict, the singer issued her first statement, expressing relief.

Rakul Preet on private wedding: Kept no-phone policy so everyone could enjoyActor Rakul Preet Singh shares why she and Jackky Bhagnani kept their Goa wedding private. She wanted a simple, joyful celebration, valuing moments over luxury. She will next be seen in Mere Husband Ki Biwi.

sports.headline: Pakistan has no pressure: Babar Azam ahead of Champions Trophy opener vs NZChampions Trophy: Star batter Babar Azam has claimed that Pakistan are under no pressure ahead of their Champions Trophy opening match against New Zealand on Wednesday, February 19. Babar was part of Pakistan's Champions Trophy winning squad in 2017.

Arshdeep Singh over Harshit Rana to replace Jasprit Bumrah: Ricky PontingRicky Ponting backed Arshdeep Singh over Harshit Rana as India's best replacement for injured Jasprit Bumrah in the Champions Trophy, citing Arshdeep's control and experience in white-ball cricket as key factors for India's bowling attack.

Multi-nation events could be key to reviving its relevance in a crowded cricketing calendar.

New Zealand has squad depth for Champions Trophy despite injuries: BondDespite injury setbacks, Shane Bond believes New Zealand's squad depth remains strong, emphasising their all-rounders' impact and confidence from recent triumphs ahead of the Champions Trophy opener against Pakistan in Karachi on February 19.

Fully fit Novak Djokovic handed shock Qatar Open exit by Matteo BerrettiniNovak Djokovic's struggles in 2025 continued as he suffered a shocking Round of 32 defeat to Matteo Berrettini at the Qatar Open. The Italian dominated after a tiebreak first set to claim a 7-6 (4), 6-2 win.

Champions Trophy FAQs: Your complete guide to the returning mini World Cup Champions Trophy 2025 FAQs: In these 13 FAQs, we have covered everything you need to know about the ICC Champions Trophy 2025, from the schedule and venues to team line-ups and live streaming details. Defending champions Pakistan face big test vs in-form New Zealand todayChampions Trophy: Pakistan recently lost the tri-series final to New Zealand, but will be looking to make amends when the two teams face each other on February 19 at National Stadium in Karachi.

Champions Trophy preview and team ratings: Are India the favourites?The Champions Trophy returns to the cricket calendar after eight years, marking a significant moment for Pakistan, which hosts a major ICC event for the first time in 29 years. Eight teams will compete for the prestigious title, once famously dubbed the mini-World Cup.

New Zealand won't rush Rachin Ravindra's recovery for Pakistan openerChampions Trophy 2025: Wicketkeeper-batter Tom Latham, speaking to the press in Karachi on Tuesday, said New Zealand are wary of Rachin Ravindra's head injury and will not rush his recovery for the opening match on Wednesday.

Mohammed Siraj goes on Umrah trip ahead of Champions Trophy Indian fast bowler Mohammed Siraj embarked on a spiritual journey to Masjid Al Haram in Saudi Arabia ahead of the Champions Trophy, set to begin on February 19.

Watch: Neeraj Chopra adds Rs 3 crore beast to his collection of luxury cars Neeraj Chopra has added a Rs 3 crore customised SUV to his luxury car collection, featuring exclusive blue-themed details and high-performance upgrades. With a top speed of 305 km/h and a roaring custom exhaust, this the car is the most special addition to his garage.

India U19 hero G Kamalini becomes youngest debutant with Mumbai Indians capWPL 2025: G Kamalini became the youngest debutant in the history of the tournament after getting her maiden cap for the Mumbai Indians (MI) in the clash against Gujarat Giants (GG) on Tuesday at the Kotambi Stadium in Vadodara.

Shardul Thakur signs for Essex, to play County Championship after IPL 2025 snubAll-rounder Shardul Thakur will make his County Championship debut for Essex. The Mumbai star will play the premier first-class tournament in England after having lost out on an IPL contract.

Pakistan will enjoy Champions Trophy as a nation: Mohammad Rizwan Champions Trophy 2025: In the press-conference before the clash against New Zealand, Pakistan skipper Mohammad Rizwan welcomed the return of an ICC event to Pakistan after 29 years, and praised the people who worked hard to organise the tournament.

Keep underestimating us: Pakistan captain's plea to pundits before Champions TrophyChampions Trophy 2025: On the eve of Pakistan's opening match against New Zealand in Karachi, captain Mohammad Rizwan addressed the press, discussing the return of an ICC tournament to Pakistan and the team's enduring underdog status at major events.

India will miss accuracy and calm of Jasprit Bumrah in Champions Trophy: Shikhar DhawanIndia have a strong squad but will miss the accuracy and calm of Jasprit Bumrah in the Champions Trophy, said Shikhar Dhawan. Bumrah has been ruled out of the side due to a back injury.

King kar lega? After Babar Azam's plea, Rizwan reacts to viral one-linerChampions Trophy: Mohammad Rizwan responded to repeating Hasan Ali's popular one-liner 'King kar lega' while showing faith in Babar Azam's ability. Rizwan attended the press conference before Pakistan's clash against New Zealand in Karachi.

IND vs PAK is a great thing for javelin: Neeraj on rivalry with Arshad NadeemNeeraj Chopra is glad that India vs Pakistan rivalry in javelin is taking the sport to different heights alltogther. Neeraj and Arshad shared two spots in the Paris Olympics podium in 2024.

Babar Azam is the right man to open in Champions Trophy: Rizwan Champions Trophy 2025: Mohammad Rizwan said that Babar Azam would open the batting in the mega event. Babar has only 88 runs to his name as an ODI opener at an average of 17.60.

Bombay High Court rules in favour of BCCI in Tax Exemption CaseThe Bombay High Court has quashed an Income Tax Department advisory questioning BCCI's tax-exempt status, ruling that any decision regarding its exemption must follow due statutory process rather than relying on non-statutory communication from tax authorities.

BCCI allows families to attend one match in Dubai, prior permission neededThe Indian cricket board has allowed families and partners of cricketers to watch one match of the Champions Trophy 2025. However, the players will need to inform the BCCI and seek permission from them prior to the game.

Flick defends VAR after Barcelona return to top of LaLiga with controversial winFC Barcelona regained the lead in LaLiga with a controversial 1-0 win over Rayo Vallecano. Barcelona coach reacted to a contensious decision by VAR which helped Barcelona sneak a win and wipe out their point-difference against bitter rivals Real Madrid.

Champions Trophy history: 8 editions, 7 champions in Mini World Cup's wild journeyChampions Trophy 2025: No other tournament in cricket history has faced as many threats of being scrapped, but the Champions Trophy has survived multiple deliberations to return to the ICC calendar after an eight-year gap -- the longest between two editions of the ODI tournament.

Mission 90m is on: Neeraj Chopra on how legend Zelezny is moulding his techniqueDouble Olympic medallist Neeraj Chopra is working with his new coach Jan Zelezny. The legendary former javelin star has been working on correcting Neeraj's technique post the Paris Olympics.

Champions Trophy: New Zealand name Jamieson as Lockie Ferguson's replacementChampions Trophy 2025: New Zealand suffered another setback as Lockie Ferguson was ruled out of the Champions Trophy due to injury, with Kyle Jamieson named as his replacement. The Black Caps now await further updates on Rachin Ravindra's fitness.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
